intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium laevigatum subsp. squalidinaevum, commonly known as the squalidinaevum hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. The plant has basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a rough, hairy texture. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and are borne on slender stems. It is characterized by its small, glandular hairs and a tendency to form dense colonies.
